title: A 45-Year-Old Male with Rotator Cuff Injury
clinical_history: A 45-year-old male, who works as a construction worker, presents with a 3-week history of right shoulder pain. He reports that the pain started after a fall while working on a scaffold, where he landed on his outstretched arm. He has been experiencing pain and stiffness in his right shoulder, which has worsened over time. He has difficulty lifting his arm above 90 degrees and has limited mobility in his shoulder joint.
aggrevating_factors: abduction, flexion, and extension of the shoulder joint; lifting heavy objects; sleeping on the affected side
picture: pain and stiffness in the right shoulder region
easing_factors: rest; application of heat or cold packs; gentle pendulum exercises
past_history: previous episodes of shoulder pain, 5 years ago, which resolved with physical therapy; no previous surgeries
medical_history: generally healthy; takes occasional NSAIDs for pain relief
medications: ibuprofen 400mg, 3 times a day, as needed
personal_history: married with two children; works full-time as a construction worker; enjoys playing golf on weekends
imaging: X-rays and MRI of the right shoulder, showing a partial tear of the supraspinatus tendon
